entities: Group of Experts on the DRC
reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports every 90 days, mid-term report no later than 30 December 2020, and a final report no later than 15 June 2021
summary:
The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), reaffirms its commitment to the country's sovereignty, independence, unity, and territorial integrity. The Council expresses concern over the presence of armed groups in Eastern DRC, which impose suffering on civilians, and the illegal exploitation and trade of natural resources that enables these groups. 

The Council decides to renew until 1 July 2021 the measures set out in paragraphs 1 to 6 of resolution 2293 (2016). It reaffirms that these measures shall apply to individuals and entities designated by the Committee. 

The Council extends until 1 August 2021 the mandate of the Group of Experts, and requests the Secretary-General to take necessary administrative measures to re-establish the Group. The Group is to provide a mid-term report by 30 December 2020, a final report by 15 June 2021, and submit monthly updates to the Committee. 

The Council reaffirms reporting provisions and recalls the Guidelines of the Committee for the Conduct of its Work. It calls on Member states to use these procedures and criteria, including on listing and delisting. 

The Council decides to remain seized of the matter.
